direct_answer.text: To calculate the cost James spends on pistachios per week, first, establish his consumption pattern. Given he eats half a can of pistachios every 5 days, convert this into a weekly basis. There are seven days in a week, so dividing those 7 days by the span of 5 days results in one full five-day segment plus two extra days left over - essentially covering three weeks entirely when rounded up to prevent running out prematurely. As it stands, for simplicity sake, assuming consistency across different timescales, consume exactly 1 four-fifths (0.8) of a can per week because (.5 * 7 / 5 = .8). Now multiply this usage value by the fixed cost of a single can which totals 1 dollar ($10): $1 x 0.8 yields $8. Thus, taking everything considered, Charles James pays precisely eight US Dollars every week solely for pistachios.
